title: After Nearly 50 Years In Office, Conyers Might Not Make The Ballot
teaser: A local elections official has ruled that Rep. John Conyers of Detroit, who's served in the House for nearly 50 years, has failed to collect enough valid signatures to appear on the Democratic primary ballot. He's appealing the decision; if he loses, it could be an ignominious end to a distinguished career.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
